plugin_info.plugin_description: Import a network saved in a set of CSV files into Hydra.
plugin_info.plugin_epilog: Written by Philipp Meier philipp@diemeiers.ch (c) Copyright 2013, University College London. For more information visit www.hydra-network.com

arg.name: nodes
arg.help: One or multiple files containing nodes and attributes.

arg.name: links
arg.help: One or multiple files containing information on links.

arg.name: project
arg.help: The ID of an existing project. If no project is specified or if the ID provided does not belong to an existing project, a new one will be created.

arg.name: scenario
arg.help: Specify the name of the scenario created by the import function. Every import creates a new scenario. If no name is provided a default name will be assigned.

arg.name: network_id
arg.help: The ID of an existing network. If no network_id is specified, a new network will be created. If a network id is specified, the network will be updated and a new scenario created for the data.

arg.name: network
arg.help: Specify the file containing network information. If no file is specified, a new network will be created using default values.

arg.name: timezone
arg.help: Specify a timezone as a string following the Area/Location pattern (e.g. Europe/London). This timezone will be used for all timeseries data that is imported. If you don't specify a timezone, it defaults to UTC.

arg.name: groups
arg.help: One or multiple files containing information on groups.

arg.name: group_members
arg.help: One or multiple files containing information on the members of the groups specified in the -g argument.

arg.name: template
arg.help: One XML containing the template appropriate to the network bing imported.

arg.name: server_url
arg.help: Specify the URL of the server to which this plug-in connects.

arg.name: session_id
arg.help: Specify the session ID for the connection. If not specified, the plugin will try to connect based on the credentials it finds in config

arg.name: expand-filenames
arg.help: If the import function encounters something that looks like a filename, it tries to read the file. It also tries to guess if it contains a number, a descriptor, an array or a time series.
